section.title: Turning Off a Virtual Machine from the User Portal
section.para: If you attempt to turn off a virtual machine from the User Portal, it may freeze with a status of Powering Down, indicating that it has not completely shut down.

important.para: To minimize the risk of data loss, log off from a virtual machine before turning it off.

procedure.title: Turning Off a Virtual Machine from the User Portal

step.para: Log out of the guest operating system.
If you were using your virtual machine in full screen mode, press ShiftF11 to exit full screen mode, and close the virtual machine's console window. You are now returned to the User Portal.

To turn off the virtual machine, click the
button. The Stop symbol appears next to the name of the virtual machine when it has been turned off.

note.para: You can also turn off virtual machines gracefully using the native method from within the virtual machine itself. For example, in Windows virtual machines you can click StartShut Down, and in Red Hat Enterprise Linux virtual machines you can click SystemShut Down.
